fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24260].
  {panel}

Hi experts,

our R&D department uses the wiki as the knowledge base for development projects.
They are now establishing 3D pdf files as the standard format for CAD drawings.

Unfortunately its not possible to embed the pdf with the view file macro.

It would be nice if this feature were implemented in the next versions.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,
Manuel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24258].
  {panel}

Currently, page history just shows the latest version of any included page on the page.
Here is an example:

This page view (from March 2011) appears to show documentation for a feature not released until Dec 2011 (i.e. global pdf setup in Confluence 4.1). That's misleading and confusing.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=252349179&navigatingVersions=true

That happens because the feature is documented on the included page.

This is how the page actually looked in Mar 2011:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet
fields.summary: Page history view should know to display the chronologically correct included page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24256].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Whitelist http://google.com
# Add the html-include macro on a page.
# Specify http://google.com as the address.

The preview pane will be blank, as will the section where the macro should be when you add it and preview/save the page.

This also affects all Google search pages, for instance http://google.de would also not work.
fields.summary: html-include macro renders blank when trying to include google.com
Pasting a file into the editor causes 422 Unprocessable Entity Errors and errors saving a draft as well as locking you out from editing the page any further

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24252].
  {panel}

We've managed to make Dashboard layout look like page in Documentation Theme. Please find a screenshot in attachment. 

But some efforts needed.

First, insert into /decorators/global.wmd  code
{code}
<content tag="tree">
some users macro....
</content>
{code}

This action adds Splitbar to dashboard. But, when we are on Dashboard, Space is undefined. That is why error raising when rendering left menu on Dashboard.

To fix this, open doctheme.jar/doctheme/decorators/main.wmd
Find the following code fragment
{code}
#if ($!docThemeHelper.getThemeHeader($spaceKey)!="")
    $!sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.theme-header")
#end
{code}

and replace it with:
{code}
#if ($spaceKey)
    #if ($!docThemeHelper.getThemeHeader($spaceKey)!="")
        $!sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.theme-header")
    #end
#end
{code}


So, we need to make these changes every time when DocTheme updates. It will be nice to fix it and relax.

By the way, where does doctheme jar file lives after plugin installation? Usually it appears inside atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip in confluence-4.0/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup. But since  two of three recent versions, I could not find it there.
fields.summary: Applying Documentation Theme to Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24251].
  {panel}

There will be quite useful to add two parameters that might be changed through Administration Console:
1. Render Labels
2. Render Children

We are using Confluence with Documentation Theme as Company Intranet Portal. This theme suites us well, but we do not use Label as well as Children on each display.

Every time we install Doctheme update, we have to modify
doctheme-x.x.x.jar/doctheme/decorators/page.vmd

Find the following code fragment:
  
#parse ("/labels/labels-dialog.vm")
#parse ("/labels/labels-editor.vm")
#renderChildren()

and replace it with:
 
##parse ("/labels/labels-dialog.vm")
##parse ("/labels/labels-editor.vm")
##renderChildren()

(just to comment these strings). It's uncomfortable a bit)

Is there any way to store these settings separately, e.g. in properties file or database? Settings should keep their values when Doctheme updates.
fields.summary: Configuration of Documentation Theme
Paste images has broken after re-implementing FF7 drag and drop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24247].
  {panel}

Can we add a feature that would allow us to add a Not or ! condition to the query? Right now I can do something like this:

1. Show all content where label = first OR label = second OR label = third
2. Show all content where label = first AND label = second AND label = third

What I would like to do is something like this:

1. Show all content where (label = first AND label = second AND label = third) AND Not label = forth

Basically that would like pages with all of those labels but not pages that include the final label. The use case for this is that we have built a nice page that shows all of our projects tagged with different labels that describe information about those projects such as priority. What I would like is when a label 'archive' is added to a page it will then automatically not show up on the project page. The old labels need to stay on the page for historical purposes.

Note that this was submitted to support via this link: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-73759
fields.summary: Label by Content Improvement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24245].
  {panel}

{panel}
*Note:* the workaround is to merge dangling cells into the left cell.
{panel}

Missing the ability to delete table cells, if we had this we could create "pyramid tables" as we could before using the rich text editor.

E.g.

| 1 |
| 2 | 3 |
| 4 | 5 | 6 |

(used for ½ matrixes)

Updating such a table also needs some thought because using the "insert markup" can actually create such a table, but we can't extend it to:

| 1 |
| 2 | 3 |
| 4 | 5 | 6 |
| 7 | 8 | 9 | 0 |

Instead we have to create it from buttom.

Copy pasting table rows through "Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V", so maybe just as well as being able to delete cells, we should be able to "Split" a single cell in a single row or something, I am really now sure how the best way would be, before we just added the row with an extra cell at the end...
fields.summary: Delete Table Cell
Cut, Paste Table row cant be performed to put a row at the buttom.

  {panel}

Confluence 4.1 supports Autoconvert for Skitch and other third-party services.

It would be great if we added [CloudApp|http://getcloudapp.com/] to this list. 

Note: CloudApp also has support for quick sharing code (e.g. http://cl.ly/1v350z3T1i3m0t01313V)

If we pasted the URL and recognised it was code, we could easily embed that in as well.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24208].
  {panel}

For example: 

|a|b|c|d|
|a|z|z|d|
|a|z|z|d|
|a|b|c|d|

Allow the ability to select the 2x2 square in the centre containing only Z's. 

Right now, if you drag using your mouse, Confluence gives the impression that it is only selecting these 4 cells. On releasing of the mouse button, you get a resulting selection that encompasses:

| |z|z|d|
|a|z|z| |
 
Fix this, to allow copying pasting of subsets as well as 1xN subsets (which is effectively a column)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24202].
  {panel}

Currently, each page has a tiny link, but if we want to link somebody to a particular comment, we have to append the comment fragment to the end of the tiny link.

It'd be nice if we could link directly to a comment with a tiny link.

Original discussion on #gradlassian:

{noformat}
12:51:19 PM peggy: is there a way to get a shorturl to a comment on confluence?
12:55:42 PM puxlit: doesn't [Page#comment-12345] work?
12:56:13 PM peggy: well as in you can link to a page using: https://extranet.atlassian.com/x/cQ3Qbw
12:56:19 PM peggy: instead of the entire URL
12:56:24 PM puxlit: ah
12:56:51 PM peggy: but can't seem to find a similar tinylink feature for specifying a comment
12:57:16 PM puxlit: https://extranet.atlassian.com/x/cQ3Qbw#comment-1876558365 works, but I know what you mean
12:57:23 PM puxlit: *shrugs*
12:57:27 PM puxlit: perhaps it's not implemented
12:57:29 PM puxlit: bit.ly!
1:00:27 PM peggy: hm the shortlink+">#coment-<id> willd o for now
1:00:29 PM peggy: will do for now*
1:00:31 PM peggy: ty!
1:01:04 PM puxlit: I guess we should raise a feature request for this
{noformat}

Please see [video|http://screencast.com/t/gkLwUthIVz]

The displacement of the emoticon does not happen when using the emoticon toolbar to insert the emoticon. However, the jumping effect on the editor persists.

The displacement of the emoticon seems to happen when the emoticon is inserted in the begining of a bullet point that is preceded by an indendeted bullet point.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24156].
  {panel}

In most cases Confluence sends e-mails sothat FROM address is the one configured globally as described here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail, field "From Address".

In case of mentions, however, it tries to use the e-mail address of the currently authenticated user as the FROM address. It still authenticates to the mail server as the globally configured user. This causes problems in case of Exchange mail server when users are not allowed to send e-mails on behalf of others. In this case Exchange throws "550 5.7.1 Client does not have permissions to send as this sender" error.

The workaround is to configure Exchange so that it allowes to send as any sender as described here: http://www.petri.co.il/forums/showthread.php?p=154834. 

It would, however, be useful to be able to configure the way Confluence handles FROM addresses in case of mentions. It should be possible to send from the globally configured address in the same way all other mails are sent.
fields.summary: Mention e-mails FROM address
Quick search should be a sub-set of full search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24147].
  {panel}

h4.Description
When using JIRA Issues macro in Confluence, 'number type' fields are rendered differently from JIRA. Instead of showing the value that is displayed in JIRA, it just takes the value straight from the database, and put it in to JIRA Issues macro.  For example: If the number is displaying in JIRA with no decimals, in Confluence it will display a decimal. 

h4.Findings
JIRA is using some vm template to convert the value that is stored in database that makes it easier to be read by end user. However, for JIRA Issues Macro, it doesn't do the same thing, hence, making it difficult to be read by end user.

!issues-macro-1.png|width=400! !issues-macro-2.png|width=400!
\\

!issues-macro-db.png|width=900!
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro render number fields differently than in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24142].
  {panel}

* Info, Tip, Warning and Error are pretty much the same thing with a different coat of paint.
* One way to fix this is by merging all those macros into one (message macro?) and have a parameter that was a select field to to choose the type 'tip', 'info' etc.
* Then we'd add buttons to switch between tips, message, etc and another button to show/hide the icons.
* We should make sure users still get the message macro when they search for "tip" or "warning" etc in autocomplete and the macro browser.

Q: Are people who just want to add a warning macro going to be annoyed that there's now an extra step?
fields.summary: User wants to be able to quickly switch between status, tip, warning and info macros
Make subsections of pages editable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24138].
  {panel}

{noformat}
<ac:link>
  <ri:page ri:content-title="Creating your Technical Documentation Space" />
  <ac:link-body>
    <ac:macro ac:name="screenshot"> <!-- my own macro -->
      <ac:parameter ac:name="align">center</ac:parameter>
      <ac:parameter ac:name="file">documentation_icon.ss</ac:parameter>
    </ac:macro>
  </ac:link-body>
</ac:link>
{noformat}

From a logical point of view, this is valid. I just define a link and its anchor is macro. However, Confluence is not able to render it. "Broken macro" appears instead of the link. Macro itself is not broken, it would render outside of the ac:link.

And no, implementing {{ac:parameter ac:name="link"}} in plugin on my own is not a good idea. Native links have great support in editor - it's possible to browse and point to page, attachment and other resources from current Confluence.

(I am a plugin developer and I work directly on XHTML storage format)
fields.summary: can't make macro become a link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24133].
  {panel}

h3. Intended behaviour specification

If you have: 

{panel}
# first
# second

third
{panel}

Pressing the numbered bullet list toolbar button or the Ctrl + Shift + B keyboard shortcut at "third" should produce: 

{panel}
# first
# second
# third
{panel}

Similarly if the text is between two numbered lists: 

{panel}
# first
# second

third

# fourth
# fifth
{panel}

We should get: 

{panel}
# first
# second
# third
# fourth
# fifth
{panel}

If there is a nested ordered list preceding the text: 

{panel}
# first
## second

third
{panel}

Then: 

{panel}
# first
## second
## third
{panel}

This behaviour should activate if the cursor is: 
- anywhere among the word "third"
- if the word "third" is wholly selected

Webkit only. 

When I type \*foo\* in the editor and it autoformats I expect: 
- foo to be bolded
- the cursor to be blinking just after the word foo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24073].
  {panel}

Comalatech's Ad-Hoc workflow plugin still leaves a lot to be desired in a edit/approve/publish workflow cycle. For technical documents like ISO9001 controlled documents and all kinds og specification documents, it is absolutely essential that the documents are alive while only the published version is available to everyone. The Comalatech plugin accomplishes this to a certain degree.

Points of improvement over what's currently available:
-Ideally, only the *published* versions should be visible in the version history
- the space owner should have the possibility to escalate other users' privileges up to his own to allow editing specific documents on request - i.e. the reverse of the current "restrict" privilege
- some kind of attribute should follow the controlled page enforcing the publish privilege
- approvals must be logged with which users approved the document, essential for the electronic paper trail
fields.summary: Native support for contribute/publish workflow
Testing Word document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24054].
  {panel}

Hey, not really sure how to word the title properly, please do edit the title to make it more obvious. 

Basically the problem is this, since there are no longer Wiki Markup in Confluence 4, users are not able to copy the markup of content in a page to be kept in a text file or html file. The workaround is this:

# Go to the page that you wish to export, and click "Edit"
# On Chrome, press F12 to bring up the developer Console. (same shortcut key on Firefox as well, only if Firebug is installed as addon)
# Click on Console
# Run this command in the Console:
{code}
tinyMCE.activeEditor.getContent()
{code}
# Copy all of the XHTML content generated by the command
# Paste it in a text file, and save it as a .html file. 
To import,
# Open the .html file in a browser.
# Copy all contents shown in the browser (Ctrl+A, then Ctrl+C)
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Paste the contents into the page.

It would be nice to at least, auto generate these HTML files with a click of a button, for non tech savvy users.
fields.summary: Provide an easier way to save page formatting in a text/html file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24049].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Paste a block of text that involves more than one paragraph into a body macro
e.g.
{noformat}
Please award me the world's best dog petter award

I am really good at petting dogs
{noformat}
# Highlight the text and attempt to delete or cut the text - the text will stay put.

This can be reproduced consistently on the first time a page is created - however, if the defect is attempted to be reproduced subsequent times the defect may not appear.
Alternate behaviours include:
* the highlighted text is deleted as normal, leaving the macroplaceholder
* the macro placeholder is deleted with the highlighted text



h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
4.0 CAC
4.1 OD GAPPS
h6. Browsers
IE8

(no repro)
Chrome
fields.summary: Erratic behaviour when attempting to delete content from a body macro in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24045].
  {panel}

Currently "Export to PDF" in Space Administration creates a PDF with its order based on hierarchy levels from high to low. For example, in a space with the following structure:

* Home
** Major Branch A
*** Minor Branch
** Major Branch B

If "Minor Branch" and "Major Branch B" are selected to be exported, "Major Branch B" would actually be displayed first in the resulting PDF, since it is at a higher level than the "Minor Branch" (2nd versus 3rd). In other words, Confluence looks from the root to the next major branch that is selected, rather than generating the PDF top-down.

While this is logical, it may not be the way users expect PDF exports to work. It would be nice to add an option to generate the PDF based on the order displayed within Confluence, despite the pages' hierarchy level. When such an option is selected, the PDF generated in example above would have "Minor Branch" come before "Major Branch B", since it appears first in top-down.
fields.summary: Add option to sort exported PDF by displayed order when space is partially selected
Import Multiple Word Documents
{recently-updated} macro should display comments whit labels to
Allow quick insertion of macros, links and embedded content using autoformat

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24028].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce: 

# insert a table 
# insert a code macro after the table with some text
# click the header of the macro placeholder to select it and then copy
# now position the cursor inside a table cell and paste
# only the contents of the code macro (and not the placeholder chrome) will be pasted
fields.summary: Copying and pasting a macro placeholder into a table cell only copies the contents of the macro placeholder

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24026].
  {panel}

There are several related parts to this suggested improvement.

Recommendations:
1. Treat macros and all special editor objects (images, links, etc) the same - i.e. they would all have a frame.

2. Display all of the associated parameters of the object (macro, image, link, etc) as text in the header of the objects frame not a subset and not with ...

3. Allow the parameters in the frame to be edited as name value pairs and re-interpreted when focus leaves the frame.

4. Treat the text in the frame header like other text and support cursor movement in/out and through it. Include the text in searches.

Reasoning (by #):
1. Currently the new editor doesn't treat everything as equivalent.
* This results in issues with where the insertion point moves during editing, what is selected, what gets cut or pasted, etc. Treating everything special (i.e. macros, images, links - things with parameters and/or bodies) as a framed object allows everything to be treated as an object, just like a character of text.
* Providing the frame also now allows you to explicitly see what is inside and outside a special object and allows you to select the object. For example, there is currently no way to select a link. You can select text that is linked, you can select an image that is linked, but you can't select a link.

2. By displaying all parameters on all macros and special objects it becomes obvious how a page is constructed.
* Entering edit mode should expose all of the hidden information that is not visible when the page is rendered. Currently entering edit mode results in a subset of some parameters being displayed. This leads only to more confusion and requires the user to still having to enter a deeper edit mode (i.e. the macro browser or the special popups) to see the true values to edit. An edit mode within an edit mode is a huge productive hit. 
* A guiding rule should be "While in edit mode the user will be able to inspect the page and see all the properties effecting how the page renders without needing to do any further activities." If this rule was true a majority of the productivity hit of the new editor would be resolved. To do this requires displaying all of the parameters of macros and special objects in their frame. For example, a warning macro's "show icon" is not shown in the frames parameters. This means that a users must hunt and peck across many instances if he is trying to identify one needing to be change.

3. A productivity hit of the new editor is the need to enter a sub-edit mode (the macro editor or the special popups) when making a change to a parameter that is already applied to a macro or a link/image.
* Allowing the name value parameter pairs in the frame to be edited would allow rapid changes to be made with a few keystrokes with no loss of user focus caused by having to visit a dialog.
* Allowing new parameters to be added into the frame by just typing, for example "width" which is an obvious and easily remembered parameter on many macros, would allow common edits to occur quickly.
* Parameters that could not be parsed after the edit completes (i.e. after focus leaves the frame) could be handled by highlighting or in a similar way to how firebugs lets users change the parameters in the html editor window.

4. The new editor doesn't treat everything the same. All text, in the frame or body should be editable simple by moving up/down/left/right or clicking on it. If immediately above a macro then moving down or right should move you into the macro parameters. Moving to the end of the parameters and past (right arrow repeat) should take you into the body. Pressing down arrow should take you into the parameters, pressing down arrow again should move you into the body. Cut and paste should work within these areas as well as search and replace. To be productive the content, while special, needs to be treated as text.
fields.summary: Provide frames with editable parameters for macros as well as all special editor objects
Ability to grant users permissions to edit other users profiles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24020].
  {panel}

Problem description:
1. Create a 2 sample pages called Yahoo & Google under the same space
2. Edit the Yahoo page
3. Click on Link button where the Insert Link frame will appear
4. Under 'Search' link, I typed in Google and the page appeared and I selected on it
5. Then, I clicked under 'Advanced' link
6. The "Google" word does not appear under Link name but it is appearing under Link Text 

This behavior above is actually intended because Confluence will try to interpret any links given under the Link name and will auto captured what ever text that you have searched under the 'Search' Link to be as the text (because you have not highlighted any text yet). 

Please go through another illustration (inside the attachment) which explains why there is a need to have the Link text remained.
fields.summary: Link disappearing even after inserting any text into the field in Advanced mode for Page Linking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24018].
  {panel}

Currently the file extension a user specify in WebDAV Launcher configuration matters:
!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/170494211/OCFirefoxAddOnOptions2.png?version=1&modificationDate=1226287463073!

So if a user specify an *xls* to be opened with MS Excel. Then one day the user has an a spreadsheet attachment with a filename: *xyz.XLS*, clicking on "Edit in Office" would cause nothing happen. This is due the WebDAV Launcher is case sensitive to the file extension. Would be great if we can make it case insensitive so it will just pick up the current configuration set.

h4. Workaraound
Either one of the following:
- Add another uppercased extension in the [WebDAV Launcher configuration|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector#InstallingtheFirefoxAdd-OnfortheOfficeConnector-ConfiguringtheAdd-On]
- Rename the attachment filename extension to be lowercase.
fields.summary: Firefox WebDAV Launcher to be case insensitive on file extensions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24016].
  {panel}

Raised from a [CAC comment|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Guide+to+User+Macro+Templates?focusedCommentId=269980593#comment-269980593].

You can specify that a plugin macro has an 'attachment' parameter type. For an example see the multimedia macro.

If you try to use 'attachment' parameters in a User Macro then the Macro Browser will render the select box but it will not populate with parameters (or even shown the 'no parameters found message').

To be fair, we haven't [documented|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Guide+to+User+Macro+Templates] this type as being available to User Macros but it is [documented for plugin macros|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Including+Information+in+your+Macro+for+the+Macro+Browser]. It should work for User Macros as well.
fields.summary: The 'attachment' macro parameter type does not work in User Macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24010].
  {panel}

This request is not to bring back Wiki Markup Editor. I promise. :P

When you add a New Wiki Block on Confluence 4.0 (Edit> Insert > Wiki Markup), a "box" is raise on the screen. This request is just to add a "Preview" button on this box, to avoid re-work for example on tables where the user misses a pipe, or a wrong wiki tag like {oformat} instead of noformat.

A preview button on this screen would be awesome :)

Attached Screenshot(Sorry about the blur effect. I'm not a professional GIMP'er..heheheh)

All the Best,
Nícolas
fields.summary: Preview Button on the Confluence 4.0 Wiki Markup Box.
Jiraissues macro documentation links to partially irrelevant information
PDF export: TOC page numbers overflow the right margin when more than 999 pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-24002].
  {panel}

For instances with a lot of groups, it would be helpful to allow multiple search terms during group search (e.g. while editing permissions).

For example, if I have the following groups:
* US-marketing-managers
* US-marketing-employees
* US-sales-managers
* US-sales-employees
* AUS-marketing-managers
* AUS-marketing-employees

It would be nice to be able to search for "US" and "managers" simultaneously to return all US management groups, or perhaps "marketing" and "employees" together to return all marketing employee groups. At this time searching for multiple terms yields no results.
fields.summary: Allow multiple search terms for Group Search when configuring permissions
Upgrade COMPATMACROS to version 2.0.1
Reach parity in behaviour between PageContext#getSpaceKey() and ConversionContext#getSpaceKey()
Navigating to a personal space for a non-existent user displays Page Not Found even if the space exists
confluence-link class dropped on copy and paste

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23993].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Click the share button to display the pop-up
* Type an email address
* Hit TAB
* The email is left in the text box. There is no error message yet the "share" button is greyed out (!)

!confluence share.png!
fields.summary: Share button greyed out, not obvious that an email address needs to be 'selected' first
make it possible to share pages also to *groups* instead of just to individuals

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23990].
  {panel}

Starting from Confluence 3.5.x until to the latest Confluence version (4.0.5), the alignment for the arrow icon in the page path seems to be misaligned to the bottom instead of being at the middle for IE 8.076 browser. See this screen shot:
!IE_8076_view.jpg|thumbnail!

The normal alignment should be something like this:
!Firefox_8_view.jpg|thumbnail!

This problem only happens in IE 8 as Firefox 8 has no problems.
fields.summary: Misaligned alignment for the arrow icon in the page path
